CoPhil EO AI/ML Training

4-Day Advanced Training on AI/ML for Earth Observation

Date

October 17, 2025

CoPhil EO AI/ML Training Programme

4-Day Advanced Training on AI/ML for Earth Observation

Advanced training for Philippine EO professionals on AI/ML applications for Disaster Risk Reduction, Climate Change Adaptation, and Natural Resource Management

About This Training

Welcome to the 4-Day Advanced Online Training on AI/ML for Earth Observation for Philippine EO Professionals. This comprehensive training is part of the CoPhil Programme (EU-Philippines Copernicus Capacity Support Programme), a flagship initiative under the European Union‚Äôs Global Gateway strategy.

NoteTraining Details

Dates: October 20-23, 2025 Instructor: Stylianos Kotsopoulos Programme: EU-Philippines CoPhil Programme

This course strengthens the Philippines‚Äô capacity to use Copernicus Earth Observation data for:

  • Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) - Flood mapping, typhoon monitoring, landslide assessment
  • Climate Change Adaptation (CCA) - Drought monitoring, agricultural resilience, coastal changes
  • Natural Resource Management (NRM) - Forest monitoring, land cover mapping, marine resources

Course Curriculum

This intensive 4-day program takes you from EO data fundamentals to deploying operational AI/ML solutions. Each day builds on previous concepts through hands-on exercises using Philippine case studies.

Format: 4 days √ó 4 sessions √ó 2 hours = 32 hours total | Mode: Online via Google Colab | Level: Intermediate to Advanced

Learning Journey

What You‚Äôll Achieve

By completing this training, you will:

üéØ Master EO Data - Work confidently with Sentinel-1 SAR and Sentinel-2 optical data, understanding their characteristics and Philippine EO infrastructure (SIYASAT, NAMRIA, DOST-ASTI). Navigate the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem and implement preprocessing pipelines.

ü§ñ Build AI/ML Models - Design, train, and evaluate machine learning (Random Forest, SVM) and deep learning models (CNNs, U-Net, YOLO) for land cover classification, flood mapping, and disaster monitoring. Master model validation, hyperparameter tuning, and deployment workflows.

üöÄ Deploy Solutions - Create scalable processing pipelines using cloud platforms and integrate with Philippine operational systems. Implement real-time monitoring solutions for DRR, CCA, and NRM applications.

üåè Apply to Real Challenges - Complete hands-on projects addressing Philippine environmental priorities using real datasets from Palawan (land cover), Central Luzon (flood mapping), Mindanao (drought monitoring), and Metro Manila (urban monitoring).

Daily Breakdown

01

EO Data & AI/ML Fundamentals

4 sessions √ó 2 hours

What you‚Äôll learn: Copernicus Sentinel missions ‚Ä¢ Philippine EO ecosystem (PhilSA, DOST-ASTI, NAMRIA) ‚Ä¢ AI/ML core concepts ‚Ä¢ Python geospatial libraries (GeoPandas, Rasterio) ‚Ä¢ Google Earth Engine

Hands-on practice: Python geospatial data processing, GEE data access, visualization workflows

Start Day 1 ‚Üí

02

Machine Learning for EO

4 sessions √ó 2 hours

What you‚Äôll learn: Random Forest & SVM classification ‚Ä¢ K-means clustering ‚Ä¢ Feature engineering for spectral indices ‚Ä¢ CNN fundamentals ‚Ä¢ Transfer learning concepts

Hands-on practice: Palawan land cover classification, model evaluation, feature importance analysis

Start Day 2 ‚Üí

03

Deep Learning for EO

4 sessions √ó 2 hours

What you‚Äôll learn: U-Net semantic segmentation ‚Ä¢ Object detection (YOLO, Faster R-CNN) ‚Ä¢ SAR flood mapping (Central Luzon) ‚Ä¢ Building detection & damage assessment ‚Ä¢ Transfer learning strategies

Hands-on practice: U-Net flood mapping implementation, YOLO building detection, model fine-tuning

Start Day 3 ‚Üí

04

Advanced Topics & Projects

4 sessions √ó 2 hours

What you‚Äôll learn: LSTMs for time series ‚Ä¢ Drought monitoring (Mindanao) ‚Ä¢ Foundation models (NASA-IBM Prithvi, Clay) ‚Ä¢ Self-supervised learning ‚Ä¢ Explainable AI (XAI)

Hands-on practice: Time series forecasting, foundation model fine-tuning, capstone project development

Start Day 4 ‚Üí

Prerequisites

Get ready for the training with these simple requirements:

Required

Technical Setup:

  • Google account (for Colab and Earth Engine)
  • Google Earth Engine account (free signup)
  • Basic Python knowledge (variables, loops, functions)
  • Modern web browser (Chrome or Firefox)
TipNo Installation Needed!

All exercises run in Google Colaboratory. No local software installation required.

Recommended Background

Helpful Knowledge:

  • Basic remote sensing concepts (bands, resolution, sensors)
  • Familiarity with machine learning terminology
  • Understanding of Philippine geography and environmental challenges
  • Experience with Jupyter notebooks (helpful but not required)
NoteNew to EO or ML?

Don‚Äôt worry! Day 1 covers all foundational concepts. We start from the basics.

Ready to get started? Follow our step-by-step setup guide to prepare your environment.

Complete Setup Guide ‚Üí

About CoPhil Programme

TipTechnical Assistance for Philippines‚Äô Copernicus Capacity Support

The CoPhil Programme is part of the EU-Philippines cooperation programme and the EU‚Äôs Global Gateway strategy.

Key Partners:

  • Philippine Space Agency (PhilSA) - Co-chair and space data authority
  • Department of Science and Technology (DOST) - Co-chair and technology advancement
  • European Union - Funding and technical cooperation
  • European Space Agency (ESA) - Copernicus programme expertise

Programme Objectives:

  • Establish Copernicus Mirror Site in the Philippines
  • Build capacity in EO data analysis and AI/ML applications
  • Co-develop pilot services for DRR, CCA, and NRM
  • Create sustainable Digital Space Campus for continued learning
  • Foster Philippine EO community of practice

Course Delivery

NoteTraining Format
  • Language: English
  • Certificate: Issued upon completion of all days and capstone project
  • Support: Live instructors, teaching assistants, and community forum

Getting Started

ImportantReady to Begin?
  1. Complete Setup - Follow our Setup Guide
  2. Review Prerequisites - Ensure you have the required accounts
  3. Start Day 1 - Begin with foundational concepts
  4. Ask Questions - Use FAQ and instructor support throughout

Start with Setup Guide ‚Üí Jump to Day 1 ‚Üí

Need Help?

Throughout the training, you can:

  • Ask questions during live sessions
  • Consult the FAQ for common issues
  • Check the Glossary for term definitions
  • Download Cheat Sheets for quick reference
  • Access the Philippine EO Resources directory
  • Contact instructors or teaching assistants

Technical Support

NoteGetting Help

For technical issues: - Google Colab problems: See Setup Guide - Data access issues: Check session-specific troubleshooting - Course questions: Contact instructors during sessions - Email support: info@philsa.gov.ph

Acknowledgments

This training is made possible through the partnership between:

  • European Union (Global Gateway Initiative)
  • Philippine Space Agency (PhilSA)
  • Department of Science and Technology (DOST)
  • European Space Agency (ESA)
  • CoPhil Programme Consortium

Funded by the European Union under the Global Gateway initiative and delivered in partnership with the Philippine Space Agency (PhilSA) and the Department of Science and Technology (DOST).

::: {.hero}
# CoPhil EO AI/ML Training Programme

### 4-Day Advanced Training on AI/ML for Earth Observation

Advanced training for Philippine EO professionals on AI/ML applications for Disaster Risk Reduction, Climate Change Adaptation, and Natural Resource Management
:::

## About This Training

Welcome to the **4-Day Advanced Online Training on AI/ML for Earth Observation** for Philippine EO Professionals. This comprehensive training is part of the **CoPhil Programme** (EU-Philippines Copernicus Capacity Support Programme), a flagship initiative under the European Union's Global Gateway strategy.

::: {.callout-note}
## Training Details

**Dates:** October 20-23, 2025
**Instructor:** Stylianos Kotsopoulos
**Programme:** EU-Philippines CoPhil Programme

This course strengthens the Philippines' capacity to use Copernicus Earth Observation data for:

- **Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR)** - Flood mapping, typhoon monitoring, landslide assessment
- **Climate Change Adaptation (CCA)** - Drought monitoring, agricultural resilience, coastal changes
- **Natural Resource Management (NRM)** - Forest monitoring, land cover mapping, marine resources
:::

## Course Curriculum

This intensive 4-day program takes you from EO data fundamentals to deploying operational AI/ML solutions. Each day builds on previous concepts through hands-on exercises using Philippine case studies.

**Format:** 4 days √ó 4 sessions √ó 2 hours = 32 hours total | **Mode:** Online via Google Colab | **Level:** Intermediate to Advanced

### Learning Journey

```{mermaid}
%%| fig-width: 10
%%| fig-align: center
graph LR
    A[Day 1<br/>EO Data &<br/>Fundamentals] --> B[Day 2<br/>Machine<br/>Learning]
    B --> C[Day 3<br/>Deep<br/>Learning]
    C --> D[Day 4<br/>Advanced<br/>Topics]

    style A fill:#003399,stroke:#003399,stroke-width:3px,color:#fff
    style B fill:#f8f9fa,stroke:#dee2e6,stroke-width:2px,color:#495057
    style C fill:#f8f9fa,stroke:#dee2e6,stroke-width:2px,color:#495057
    style D fill:#f8f9fa,stroke:#dee2e6,stroke-width:2px,color:#495057
```

### What You'll Achieve

By completing this training, you will:

::: {.learning-objectives}
**üéØ Master EO Data** - Work confidently with Sentinel-1 SAR and Sentinel-2 optical data, understanding their characteristics and Philippine EO infrastructure (SIYASAT, NAMRIA, DOST-ASTI). Navigate the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem and implement preprocessing pipelines.

**ü§ñ Build AI/ML Models** - Design, train, and evaluate machine learning (Random Forest, SVM) and deep learning models (CNNs, U-Net, YOLO) for land cover classification, flood mapping, and disaster monitoring. Master model validation, hyperparameter tuning, and deployment workflows.

**üöÄ Deploy Solutions** - Create scalable processing pipelines using cloud platforms and integrate with Philippine operational systems. Implement real-time monitoring solutions for DRR, CCA, and NRM applications.

**üåè Apply to Real Challenges** - Complete hands-on projects addressing Philippine environmental priorities using real datasets from Palawan (land cover), Central Luzon (flood mapping), Mindanao (drought monitoring), and Metro Manila (urban monitoring).
:::

## Prerequisites

Get ready for the training with these simple requirements:

::: {.prereq-container}
::: {.prereq-section .prereq-required}
<div class="prereq-header">
<i class="bi bi-check-circle-fill"></i>
<h3>Required</h3>
</div>

<div class="prereq-content">
**Technical Setup:**

- Google account (for Colab and Earth Engine)
- [Google Earth Engine account](https://earthengine.google.com) (free signup)
- Basic Python knowledge (variables, loops, functions)
- Modern web browser (Chrome or Firefox)

::: {.callout-tip collapse="false"}
## No Installation Needed!
All exercises run in Google Colaboratory. No local software installation required.
:::
</div>
:::

::: {.prereq-section .prereq-recommended}
<div class="prereq-header">
<i class="bi bi-star-fill"></i>
<h3>Recommended Background</h3>
</div>

<div class="prereq-content">
**Helpful Knowledge:**

- Basic remote sensing concepts (bands, resolution, sensors)
- Familiarity with machine learning terminology
- Understanding of Philippine geography and environmental challenges
- Experience with Jupyter notebooks (helpful but not required)

::: {.callout-note collapse="false"}
## New to EO or ML?
Don't worry! Day 1 covers all foundational concepts. We start from the basics.
:::
</div>
:::
:::

## About CoPhil Programme

::: {.callout-tip}
## Technical Assistance for Philippines' Copernicus Capacity Support

The **CoPhil Programme** is part of the EU-Philippines cooperation programme and the EU's Global Gateway strategy.

**Key Partners:**

- **Philippine Space Agency (PhilSA)** - Co-chair and space data authority
- **Department of Science and Technology (DOST)** - Co-chair and technology advancement
- **European Union** - Funding and technical cooperation
- **European Space Agency (ESA)** - Copernicus programme expertise

**Programme Objectives:**

- Establish Copernicus Mirror Site in the Philippines
- Build capacity in EO data analysis and AI/ML applications
- Co-develop pilot services for DRR, CCA, and NRM
- Create sustainable Digital Space Campus for continued learning
- Foster Philippine EO community of practice
:::

## Course Delivery

::: {.callout-note}
## Training Format

- **Language:** English
- **Certificate:** Issued upon completion of all days and capstone project
- **Support:** Live instructors, teaching assistants, and community forum
:::

## Getting Started

::: {.callout-important}
## Ready to Begin?

1. **Complete Setup** - Follow our [Setup Guide](resources/setup.qmd)
2. **Review Prerequisites** - Ensure you have the required accounts
3. **Start Day 1** - Begin with foundational concepts
4. **Ask Questions** - Use FAQ and instructor support throughout

[Start with Setup Guide ‚Üí](resources/setup.qmd){.btn .btn-primary}
[Jump to Day 1 ‚Üí](day1/index.qmd){.btn .btn-outline-primary}
:::

## Need Help?

Throughout the training, you can:

- Ask questions during live sessions
- Consult the [FAQ](resources/faq.qmd) for common issues
- Check the [Glossary](resources/glossary.qmd) for term definitions
- Download [Cheat Sheets](resources/cheatsheets.qmd) for quick reference
- Access the [Philippine EO Resources](resources/philippine-eo.qmd) directory
- Contact instructors or teaching assistants

## Technical Support

::: {.callout-note}
## Getting Help

For technical issues:
- **Google Colab problems:** See [Setup Guide](resources/setup.qmd)
- **Data access issues:** Check session-specific troubleshooting
- **Course questions:** Contact instructors during sessions
- **Email support:** info@philsa.gov.ph
:::

- European Union (Global Gateway Initiative)
- Philippine Space Agency (PhilSA)

- European Space Agency (ESA)
- CoPhil Programme Consortium
